definitions: A solid material which is typically hard, shiny, malleable, fusible, and ductile, with good electrical and thermal conductivity (e.g. iron, gold, silver, and aluminium, and alloys such as steel)
The steel tracks of a railway.
Gold and silver (as tinctures in blazoning).
Broken stone for use in making roads.
Molten glass before it is blown or cast.
Heavy metal or similar rock music.
